name: Closing the Distance
description: With everyone separated thanks to Q's machinations, many are feeling lonely without the people who matter most to them. According to Quark, where there's loneliness, there's profit. Help him launch his delivery business to bring the galaxy together!
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of G. Burnham, Elnor, Graduation Amanda Grayson, Mike Burnham Sr. or Caregivers will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: G. Burnham, Elnor, Graduation Amanda Grayson, Mike Burnham Sr. or Caregivers
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Laris
featured_crew.flavor: Using her hidden talents, Laris successfully repels the Romulan attack and defends Picard.

featured_crew.name: Elnor
featured_crew.flavor: Elnor grieves for Picard, someone who has played such a vital role in his life.

featured_crew.name: Burnham
featured_crew.flavor: An undercover operative posing as a xenoanthropologist, Mike is always ready to protect his family.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Sisko
rewards.flavor: Promoted to Captain, Benjamin Sisko was recognized for his accomplishments as Commander of Deep Space Nine.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Laris
rewards.flavor: Using her hidden talents, Laris successfully repels the Romulan attack and defends Picard.

rewards.name: Burnham
rewards.flavor: An undercover operative posing as a xenoanthropologist, Mike is always ready to protect his family.

rewards.name: Elnor
rewards.flavor: Elnor grieves for Picard, someone who has played such a vital role in his life.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Find forlorn hearts with the Ferengi Alliance.
Bridge the divide with the Klingon Empire.
Connect people across the galaxy with the Cardassians.

screens.text: "Captain, I hear you've been in contact with my son. I hope that you might be able to help me with something. I am used to Spock being far away, but I have always been able to at least contact him. Perhaps it is a human weakness of mine, but I miss him."

"That is not weakness. That is love. The same love you showed our Michael. And I understand how you feel. It's strange how we've spent so much of our lives light years apart, but the loneliness is so much more intense without the ability to contact each other remotely."

"Loneliness, you say? Well, you're in luck. With the opp--I mean, the tragedy of the galactic displacement, I'm launching my newest venture. Quark's Delivery Service! Track down your loved ones and show them you care with stuff! Delivery fee is only one bar of latinum!"

"Your delivery fee is a bit high, and more importantly, with all the navigation and comm systems still being down, how will you find anyone? Maybe if you ask nicely, the Captain here could lend you a hand?"

"Captain, I hear you've been in contact with my son. I hope that you might be able to help me with something. I am used to Spock being far away, but I have always been able to at least contact him. Perhaps it is a human weakness of mine, but I miss him."

"That is not weakness. That is love. The same love you showed our Michael. And I understand how you feel. It's strange how we've spent so much of our lives light years apart, but the loneliness is so much more intense without the ability to contact each other remotely."

"Loneliness, you say? Well, you're in luck. With the opp--I mean, the tragedy of the galactic displacement, I'm launching my newest venture. Quark's Delivery Service! Track down your loved ones and show them you care with stuff! Delivery fee is only one bar of latinum!"

"Your delivery fee is a bit high, and more importantly, with all the navigation and comm systems still being down, how will you find anyone? Maybe if you ask nicely, the Captain here could lend you a hand?"
"Well, Captain, I appreciate you doing the leg work for me. Now that the business is set up and ready to go, we just have to let the latinum roll in."

"I wouldn't get too comfortable, Quark. I've heard the Duras Sisters liked your idea so much, they decided to start their own little venture. And seeing as they aren't bound to strictly legal means of operation, you could be looking at some stiff competition."

responses.text: "It's odd to hear the Duras Sisters interested in something this sentimental."
"I wouldn't worry too much, Quark. You've got a pretty solid team."
"More services like yours increases the possibility the lost will be reconnected."

screens.text: "I was also approached by someone claiming to work for another Ferengi starting their own business that sounded suspiciously like yours, Quark. I told them that I had already placed an order with you, but I thought you should know."
"Eh, some Klingons'll do anything for a buck. Clearly they lack the care and sensitivity my altruistic venture has."
"If you do say so yourself, hm? I can't exactly argue with you though. I suppose I just need to be confident in my business acumen, it's gotten me this far."

"And the possibility that my customer pool will dry up quicker than you can say Grand Nagus. I mean, that's nice and all, but I'm trying to run a business here and the exclusivity of my product is a major selling point."
"At the end of the day, Captain, we -- I mean you -- are going to have to work overtime to outsell the competition. So get out there and make our customers happy!"
"Well, Captain, I appreciate you doing the leg work for me. Now that the business is set up and ready to go, we just have to let the latinum roll in."

"I wouldn't get too comfortable, Quark. I've heard the Duras Sisters liked your idea so much, they decided to start their own little venture. And seeing as they aren't bound to strictly legal means of operation, you could be looking at some stiff competition."

responses.text: "It's odd to hear the Duras Sisters interested in something this sentimental."
"I wouldn't worry too much, Quark. You've got a pretty solid team."
"More services like yours increases the possibility the lost will be reconnected."

screens.text: "I was also approached by someone claiming to work for another Ferengi starting their own business that sounded suspiciously like yours, Quark. I told them that I had already placed an order with you, but I thought you should know."
"Eh, some Klingons'll do anything for a buck. Clearly they lack the care and sensitivity my altruistic venture has."
"If you do say so yourself, hm? I can't exactly argue with you though. I suppose I just need to be confident in my business acumen, it's gotten me this far."

"And the possibility that my customer pool will dry up quicker than you can say Grand Nagus. I mean, that's nice and all, but I'm trying to run a business here and the exclusivity of my product is a major selling point."
"At the end of the day, Captain, we -- I mean you -- are going to have to work overtime to outsell the competition. So get out there and make our customers happy!"
